results.title: Sea Festivals of Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Ben R. Hart, J Murray and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: The sea between Hong Kong and neighbouring islands is the setting for many festivals and ceremonies in Southeast Asia. A beautifully photographed film on the junk and sampan dwellers, their life, fishing and in particular their colorful religious festivals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben R. Hart, J Murray and Hong Kong Film Unit

results.title: Sculpture of Ian Bow: man into metal
results.brief_description: Presents the major work by Australian sculptor Ian Bow: the bronze cycle “The Attitudes and Passions of Man”. Comprising 23 pieces of sculpture, the cycle aims to typify the depths and shallows of human experience. The first part of the film illustrates the whole process - two-dimensional studies, small models, full-size models, casting and finishing - by which such sculpture is realised. Narrated by Eric Westbrook.

results.title: Scott Joplin: king of ragtime composers
results.creator_credit: Amelia Anderson and Anastos and Associates
results.brief_description: Presents the life and music of ragtime musician, Scott Joplin, narrated by Eartha Kitt. Includes early film footage of the Mississippi River life and the 1904 St. Louis World’s Fair.

results.title: Science of the sea
results.brief_description: The study of the sea and the work of an oceanographical institution. Explains the relationship between sea and atmosphere and illustrates the life cycle in the sea. Reveals how the bottom of the sea is charted and the sediment measured and studied.
results.description: The study of the sea and the work of an oceanographical institution. Explains the relationship between sea and atmosphere and illustrates the life cycle in the sea. Reveals how the bottom of the sea is charted and the sediment measured and studied.

results.title: Science for life
results.creator_credit: Knight Films and Peace Committee of the Society of Friends (Quakers)
results.brief_description: A teenage schoolboy is engaged in the quest for scientific knowledge. Two senior scientists bring the boy face to face with the challeng of - science to what end - life or death? A straightforward dramatisation of a debate intended to arouse lively and useful discussion for teenage audiences.

results.title: Science close-up: snake hunt
results.brief_description: Students go on a snake hunt in Florida with staff members of the Lincoln Park Zoo. The emphasis throughout is on the many species of snakes found in a relatively small area which provides a variety of living conditions.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Couchman hosts a studio discussion on schizophrenia among an audience of medical professionals, schizophrenics and others possessing a direct experience of the condition.

results.title: Couchman on customer service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Couchman addresses the issue of the quality of customer service and asks how are we to survive in the competitive and cut-throat nineties. Examples of good and bad customer service are shown in a discussion about the tactics for enduring the recession.
